alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:14AM MST until further notice by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rain and melting snow have lead to fast rising flows in rivers, which will reach critical levels. For the Oak Creek...including Cornville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding of RV park near Page Springs Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MST Wednesday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 14.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.3 feet on 02/15/2019. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 13.9 Wed 9 am MST 6.2 4.3 3.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
